org.chronos.chronodb.internal.api

Interface Lockable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ChronoDBInternal, TemporalKeyValueStore
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractChronoDB, AbstractTemporalKeyValueStore, ChunkDbTkvs, ChunkedChronoDB, InMemoryChronoDB, InMemoryTKVS, JdbcChronoDB, JdbcTkvs, MapDBChronoDB, MapDBTkvs, TemporalKeyValueStoreBase, TuplChronoDB, TuplTkvs

    public interface Lockable
    A Lockable is any object that can be locked exclusively or non-exclusively using the try-with-resources pattern.

    See lockExclusive() and lockNonExclusive() for example usages.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Lockable.LockHolder
      A Lockable.LockHolder is an object that represents ownership over some sort of Lock.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Lockable.LockHolder lockExclusive()
      Declares that a thread is about to perform an exclusive task that can not run in parallel with other tasks.
      Lockable.LockHolder lockNonExclusive()
      Declares that a thread is about to perform a non-exclusive task that can run in parallel with other non-exclusive locking tasks.

    • Method Detail

      • lockExclusive

        Lockable.LockHolder lockExclusive()
        Declares that a thread is about to perform an exclusive task that can not run in parallel with other tasks.

        All invocations of this method must adhere to the following usage pattern: 

         try (LockHolder lock = db.lockExclusive()) {
        // ... perform tasks ...
 }
        This method ensures that exclusive operations are properly blocked when another operation is taking place.
        Returns:
        The object representing lock ownership. The lock ownership will be released once Lockable.LockHolder.close() is invoked, which is called automatically by the try-with-resources statement.

      • lockNonExclusive

        Lockable.LockHolder lockNonExclusive()
        Declares that a thread is about to perform a non-exclusive task that can run in parallel with other non-exclusive locking tasks.

        All invocations of this method must adhere to the following usage pattern: 

         try (LockHolder lock = db.lockNonExclusive()) {
        // ... perform tasks ...
 }
        This method ensures that non-exclusive operations are properly blocked when an exclusive operation is taking place.
        Returns:
        The object representing lock ownership. The lock ownership will be released once Lockable.LockHolder.close() is invoked, which is called automatically by the try-with-resources statement.
